instruction: Can the red edge spectral band and MSR index be considered superior to traditional methods for predicting rubber yield using remote sensing technology?
Output: Yes, the red edge spectral band and MSR index can be considered superior to traditional methods for predicting rubber yield using remote sensing technology. According to the study mentioned in the related study, the red edge spectral band provided the best prediction with an R-2 value of 0.79 and an RMSE of 29.63 kg/ha. The MSR index, on the other hand, had the highest coefficient of determination with an R-2 value of 0.62 and an RMSE of 39.25 kg/ha. When the red edge reflectance was combined with the MSR index, the prediction model slightly improved with an R-2 value of 0.80 and an RMSE of 29.42 kg/ha. These results indicate that using the red edge spectral band and MSR index can lead to more accurate and reliable predictions of rubber yield compared to traditional methods.
